This is by far the best Airbnb I have ever stayed in. I grew up in Columbia and I had no idea there was this cool of an apartment so close to all the action. The place itself was the pinnacle of comfort and utility. The couch and bed were both so comfortable I took turns sleeping on them at night. The internet was great so I was able to work the whole time. The tv was monstrous with access to whatever you want to watch.
It was really cold one of the days and I was dreading having to go outside. Unfortunately, the batteries for the remote had died. I contacted the owner to ask if they had batteries on the property and unfortunately they did not. I was gearing up to make the couple block trek to find some, and before I could they had dropped some off for me… with a hooded sweatshirt to help keep me warm. I’m not suggesting the owner can or will go out of their way every time, but this was a level of service and kindness I haven’t seen many times. 10/10 would rent again.

Mark and co-host Danielle are kind and accommodating, and their space is stylish, clean, and quite roomy, and the location is really convenient for walking downtown. My partner's take: it was a place he was glad to return to after a day of exploring CoMO. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but there are a few things I wish I had known before booking, so here I'll just mention these things.
First, there's no shower, in the sense that you're probably used to--there's a nice tub (with great insulation for long baths) with a spray wand, but if you want to "shower" (e.g., after a long sweaty bike ride), you have to figure out how to do this while sitting in the tub (or with one hand while standing and not accidentally spraying water out of the tub? because there's no curtain).
Second, unfortunately, the house has blinds in every window except for the bathroom window, so if you like privacy in the bathroom, you should think of booking elsewhere. Finally, a few things I wished I had brought with me include (1) my own pillow (pillows were thin and sparse), and (2) tissues (only toilet paper and paper towels were provided).
I will also just mention that I booked this place--listed as "pet friendly"--hoping that my partner and I could travel with our two cats, in case we didn't find a sitter. However, this space is not really pet-friendly, in the sense that the hosts require pets stay crated whenever they are not monitored, and that they never sit on furniture, which isn't a realistic expectation regarding pet behavior, even for very well-behaved cats. In the end, I'm glad we found the sitter instead.
